2.21.20  2:03 am   i really just can't believe i live in a world where bill wurtz makes amazing content and has a crazy website and updates his questions page every day for us all to read. thank you :) maybe someday other people could live in a world where i make amazing content for them...... seems like i've got a lot more EXISTENTIALIZING to do though. i've pretty much let fear of failure and shame dictate my life for years. i'm so fearful that i'm paralyzed from doing basically anything, at least publicly. i'm so afraid of what people will think of me that i've automatically chosen the safer route of not having them think anything of me.

      i've been making music for years and years but have been showing it to less and less people, and for a long time now the number of people i show it to has been 0. don't even have the courage to post it online. it's pretty painful to be this way. it just feels too vulnerable to publicly display something i've created. feels too vulne rable to even be myself, or even admit that i like something. i'm obviously overthinking this, but i really don't know how to get out. it seems like you've struggled with something similar (?) and i was wondering if you had any advice? i'm worried the answer is "just do it" because that seems very hard and incredibly scary. anyway i didn't actually mean for this to turn into a life advice question but i guess that's how these 2:03AM questions can turn out sometimes. thanks

2.21.20  1:51 am   Do you agree that scientists are underestimating how diverse life can be, by presuming water is essential to the formation of life rather than an energy gradient?

      Comparing Io to Europa, scientists assume Europa is more likely to host life because there is water there, but that water is likely completely homogeneous in temperature, providing little energy for any life, and even less places for that energy to go.

Io is basically one large Yellowstone. Each of those geisers and vulcanic cauldrons has such a vast contrast in temperature that life may just fluke into existence like it did here.

And those are in my opinion some of the less promising bodies. Jupiter herself is so vast and full of anomalies that there could very well be life in there, too.

So basically, is water essential to life, or is water essential to Terran life.

2.21.20  1:22 am   hey it's the asker who was frustrated with not knowing why a d7 chord on the ukulele sounded bad to me when i was trying to learn it. i just wanted to let you know i just figured out how to play the melody to land of hope and glory by ear on the keyboard. it was trial and error and at the beginning i was kinda down on myself because it sounded wrong at bits and i didn't think i was smart enough to find out why, then i thought of how you told me i CAN rely on my ears to find the good sound, and in twenty or thirty minutes i HAD it. it was such a beautiful moment that i'm still practically shaking. thank you so much, you have no idea how much you've helped me. i really hope you're proud of yourself for how much joy you've unlocked within other people's lives, right here on bill wurtz dot com
